Name: Cheerful Murder Scene in a Movie
Description:
Pick an Upbeat Song, That One Might Not Normally Think of, to Play Over a Brutal Murder Scene

Also sparkles felt it important to note that this scene is in slow motion

Name: Unusual instrumentation
Description: we're looking for a band, but not just a guitar / bass / drums band

Name: Everyone Makes Mistakes: The Worst Song by a Band You Love
Description: A round by Jess. more points for worse songs.

Name: Title tracks (songs with the same name as the album they're on)
Bands that only released one album.
Description:
Artists who released one great record and then broke up, disappeared, or never made another.

Criteria:

- Band/artist must have exactly one full-length album on Spotify.

- EPs are allowed if they released one or two EPs, and most of those tracks also appear on the album.

- Singles, splits, live recordings or demos don’t count against the theme.

- If a band has both an album and an excessive number of EPs with different songs, it’s up to league discretion (let’s see how pedantic everyone gets)

Name: Submit a band that’s never been submitted in this league before
Description:
Pick a band or artist we’ve never seen in any of the 25 seasons of the league.

How to check:
Head to htmusicleaguedata.vercel.app/artists and hit Command + F (or use the search bar) to see if your pick has shown up before.

Name: You can’t afford the perfect song for your movie. What’s your replacement?
Description:
Submit the replacement song that would play in your chosen scene. In the comments, note the original famous track you’re replacing (e.g. Heroes by David Bowie, Where Is My Mind by Pixies — for Sean, it’s probably an AC/DC song), and explain why your pick still works in the scene you’re describing.

Include details about the movie scene in your entry.

Name: You probably haven't heard of them
Description: Artist must be under 41,160 monthly listeners.
